judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The record is remanded to the Courts of Montgomery County for an evidentiary hearing to determine whether Brown was denied his right to appeal.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: David N. Brook, Assistant Public Defender, for petitioner.

Richard A. Devlin, Henry T. Crocker and William T. Nicholas, Assistant District Attorneys, Parker H. Wilson, First Assistant District Attorney, and Milton 0. Moss, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, v. Brown, Petitioner.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
David N. Brook, Assistant Public Defender, for petitioner.
Richard A. Devlin, Henry T. Crocker and William T. Nicholas, Assistant District Attorneys, Parker H. Wilson, First Assistant District Attorney, and Milton 0. Moss, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
January 7, 1970:
